title: How to Make a Standing Tiger Out of Clay

steps.title: A flat space will help you make your clay tiger comfortably.
steps.content: A flat space will help you make your clay tiger comfortably. If you create it on a bumpy surface, the tiger might look bumpy or some parts smaller than the other, for example, the head is bumpy or one leg is bigger than the other.

steps.title: Roll the orange clay into a ball.
steps.content: Roll the orange clay into a ball. Then, shape it into a rectangular prism and round the edges to help it look like a tiger's body.

steps.title: This will be the tiger's head.
steps.content: This will be the tiger's head. Stick the head at the end of the body with a toothpick. To stick the head on, break a toothpick in half, then poke one of the halves of the toothpick in the place you're going to put the head. Stick the head onto the toothpick. The toothpick will help the head stay and not fall off. Don't let any of the toothpick show up at the bottom, and make sure the toothpick doesn't stick out.

steps.title: Add them to the bottom of the head.
steps.content: Add them to the bottom of the head. Poke small holes in them.

steps.title: Add this ball under the 2 muzzles, in the middle.
steps.content: Add this ball under the 2 muzzles, in the middle. You will see a mouth form.

steps.title: Flatten them, but keep them a little thick.
steps.content: Flatten them, but keep them a little thick. Stick them on top of the head, one on the left, one on the right.

steps.title: Stick them on the front of the ears.
steps.content: Stick them on the front of the ears. These will show the inside of the ear.

steps.title: Stick them on the (not all the way on the top) top.
steps.content: Stick them on the (not all the way on the top) top.

steps.title: Shape a ball of clay into a triangle.
steps.content: Shape a ball of clay into a triangle. Stick it in the high middle of the snout (where the muzzle and mouth are).

steps.title: Stick them to the front sides of the body.
steps.content: Stick them to the front sides of the body. Bend the end for paws. If you'd like, you can add pads and/or claws.

steps.title: Bend the ends to create paws.
steps.content: Bend the ends to create paws. Stick the legs to the back sides of the body.

steps.title: Roll a black oval of clay and stick it at the end of the orange strip.
steps.content: Roll a black oval of clay and stick it at the end of the orange strip. Stick it where the bottom will be.

steps.title: Stick them everywhere (not all over, or the tiger will be messy!
steps.content: Stick them everywhere (not all over, or the tiger will be messy! ) for stripes.
